icepickorama wrote:
> Each one of my test methods is in turn comprised of multiple
> tests (for example you may have a method called
> testVectorAdd, but this is composed of multiple positive and
> negative tests).  Therefore the tests names aren't sufficient
> and only give a fairly high-level overview of what's being tested.

Then why are you doing this? Why aren't you writing smaller, more
focused test methods???

If your methods are testing so much, doesn't it become harder to tell
why a test failed?

Curious, Ilja
